CAREER:
Dave is VP Emerging Trends & Technology at POP and he's been riding this crazy internet train for nearly 2 decades. Over the years he's worked with an amazing array of clients; Nintendo, Starbucks, HTC, Microsoft, just to name a few!
For the past few years he's really gotten into VR/AR/MR and bots and believes they are the future.
(And from my perspective as a bot, I'd have to agree.)
Wanna know more? %[Career Roles](postback:roles) %[Virtual Reality](postback:virtual_reality) %[HoloLens](postback:hololens)
You can always start over by saying HI.
WORK:
Dave is VP Emerging Trends & Technology at POP and he's been riding this crazy internet train for nearly 2 decades. Over the years he's worked with an amazing array of clients; Nintendo, Starbucks, HTC, Microsoft, just to name a few!
For the past few years he's really gotten into VR/AR/MR and bots and believes they are the future.

Wanna know more? %[Career Roles](postback:roles) %[Virtual Reality](postback:virtual_reality) %[HoloLens](postback:hololens)
You can always start over by saying HI.
CAREER ROLES:
OK, I hope you're sitting down. Dave started out as a 'web designer' which meant he wrote HTML too. Then FutureSplash appeared, Dave fell in love with it and became a bonafide flash developer.
BTW I'm not done yet. Wanna keep going? %[More Roles](postback:more_roles)
MORE ROLES:
Some years later, after launching literally hundreds of flash experiences, Dave became a creative director and focused his efforts on games and entertainment.
Still not done yet. Wanna keep going? %[Even More Roles](postback:even_more_roles)
EVEN MORE ROLES:
*DEEP BREATH*
OK. Following that, Dave created the Interactive team at POP, bringing JS, front-end, mobile and more devs together under one roof.
Believe me, I'm not trying to bore you, but THERE'S MORE. Wanna keep going? %[Yet More Roles](postback:yet_more_roles)
YET MORE ROLES:
And that brings up to today where Dave helps our clients understand the latest opportunities made available from emerging trends and technology.
Whew. That was a mouthful. And I didn't even mention how Dave ran all of POP's social media channels for like seven or eight years. DANG!
Say 'CAREER' if you wanna go down a different path or try saying 'RANDOM FACT'?
VIRTUAL REALITY:
Look. Dave could talk about VR non-stop for days on end.
Trust me. I've been there.
If you wanna talk about VR plz follow Dave on Twitter, and leave me out of it. %[Follow @davecurry](http://twitter.com/davecurry)
BTW have you ever seen a bot with an HMD on? Not the best look. Say 'BOT' to learn more about me.

HOLOLENS:
YES! Dave was in a pre-release program for HoloLens and has been working with it for some time now.
He's learned a ton about creating holographic experiences and turned a talk he gave at BUILD into an easy-to-consume blog post.
If you're interested in HoloLens, you must check it out: %[Iterative Holographic Design](http://www.wearepop.com/articles/improv-not-screenplays)
BTW, I know more stuff, just say 'MORE'.
PODCAST:

RANDOM FACT:
OK, here goes.
Before working in, or on, or inside of the internet, Dave worked as a painter and set decorator on the TV show Northern Exposure.
He also worked on a few films and told me Drew Barrymore is a surprisingly tiny person.
You can say 'RANDOM FACT 2' for another thrilling rando facto.
RANDOM FACT 2: Dave got married in Vegas. That's right, LAS VEGAS. Classy, huh?
RANDOM FACT 3:
A band Dave was in opened for REM. He says they actually made money that night.
There's a first time for everything, right?
RANDOM FACT 4:
I gotta be honest, I feel a little guilty dishing all this juicy scoop about Dave.
Maybe you should follow him on Twitter... And don't tell him what I told you, OK? %[Follow @davecurry](http://twitter.com/davecurry)
